question.text: Common cold differs from pneumonia in that

options.text: the causative agent for common cold is bacteria and while for pneumonia is virus
common cold affects upper respiratory tract while in pneumonia lower respiratory tract including lungs is infected
a nutritional deficiency can lead to cold while pneumonia is an infectious disease
there is no vaccine available to prevent either of the two diseases

solution.text: Common cold and Pneumonia both are infections of the respiratory tract. The common cold is a viral infection caused by Rhinoviruses while pneumonia is caused by bacteria like Streptococci and Haemophilus influenza. The common cold affects the upper respiratory tract while pneumonia affects the lower respiratory tract. Both are infectious conditions.
